org.opends.server.api

Interface IndexQueryFactory<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of query created by this factory.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IndexQueryFactoryImpl

    @PublicAPI(stability=VOLATILE,
           mayInstantiate=false,
           mayExtend=true,
           mayInvoke=false)
public interface IndexQueryFactory<T>
    A factory for creating arbitrarily complex index queries. This interface is implemented by the underlying backend implementation and passed to extensible matching rules so that they can construct arbitrarily complex index queries.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T createExactMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID, ByteSequence key)
      Returns a query requesting an index record matching the provided key.
      T createIntersectionQuery(java.util.Collection<T> subquery)
      Returns a query which returns the intersection of a collection of sub-queries.
      T createMatchAllQuery()
      Returns a query requesting all index records.
      T createRangeMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID, ByteSequence lower, ByteSequence upper, boolean lowerIncluded, boolean upperIncluded)
      Returns a query requesting all index records in the specified range.
      T createUnionQuery(java.util.Collection<T> subquery)
      Returns a query which combines the results of a collection of sub-queries.

    • Method Detail

      • createExactMatchQuery

        T createExactMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID,
                      ByteSequence key)
        Returns a query requesting an index record matching the provided key.
        Parameters:
        indexID - An identifier of the index type.
        key - A byte sequence containing the key.
        Returns:
        A query requesting the index record matching the key.

      • createMatchAllQuery

        T createMatchAllQuery()
        Returns a query requesting all index records. A backend implementation may choose to return all or no records as part of the optimization.
        Returns:
        A query requesting all index records.

      • createRangeMatchQuery

        T createRangeMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID,
                      ByteSequence lower,
                      ByteSequence upper,
                      boolean lowerIncluded,
                      boolean upperIncluded)
        Returns a query requesting all index records in the specified range.
        Parameters:
        indexID - An identifier of the index type.
        lower - The lower bound of the range. A 0 length byte array indicates no lower bound and the range will start from the smallest key.
        upper - The upper bound of the range. A 0 length byte array indicates no upper bound and the range will end at the largest key.
        lowerIncluded - true if a key exactly matching the lower bound is included in the range, false if only keys strictly greater than the lower bound are included.This value is ignored if the lower bound is not specified.
        upperIncluded - true if a key exactly matching the upper bound is included in the range, false if only keys strictly less than the upper bound are included. This value is ignored if the upper bound is not specified.
        Returns:
        A query requesting all index records in the specified range.

      • createIntersectionQuery

        T createIntersectionQuery(java.util.Collection<T> subquery)
        Returns a query which returns the intersection of a collection of sub-queries.
        Parameters:
        subquery - A collection of sub-queries.
        Returns:
        A query which returns the intersection of a collection of sub-queries.

      • createUnionQuery

        T createUnionQuery(java.util.Collection<T> subquery)
        Returns a query which combines the results of a collection of sub-queries.
        Parameters:
        subquery - A collection of sub-queries.
        Returns:
        A query which combines the results of a collection of sub-queries.
